data.title: ENJOY Arlington Classes
data.meta_description: View available activities, view our current ENJOY Arlington catalog and register for parks and recreation classes.
data.text:
More Fall ENJOY Registration Options

Web: Online registration begins at 12 p.m. for gymnastics classes on Tues., Aug. 6, aquatics classes & private swim on Wed., Aug. 7, and all other classes on Thurs., Aug. 8. Check out this tutorial to learn how to navigate the site.

Phone-In: You can call 703-228-4747 and press option 1 (option 9 for Spanish) to register by phone starting at 12 p.m. on the dates listed for the web.

Walk-In: You can register in person at Lubber Run Community Center starting on Fri., Aug. 9. You can also come to Lubber Run on Aug. 3 during Weekend Hours from 9 a.m.-4 p.m. for assistance to prepare for registration beforehand. Here you can create an account, get login information, renew or apply for fee reductions, drop off registration forms, set up payment plans and more.

Mail-In: Processing at 12 p.m. on the dates listed for the web as long as the registration office receives the forms by 5 p.m. the day before. You can mail your registration form at anytime after you have access to the catalog. Mail all forms to Lubber Run Community center at 300 N Park Dr. Arlington, VA 22203.

Non-Resident: On Aug. 14 at 8 a.m., non-residents can register by phone, online or in-person.

Credit and debit card payments made though the Arlington County Department of Parks and Recreation registration system include a non-refundable fee of 3% paid directly to the credit card processor. Arlington County does not receive any portion of the fee.

Looking for an alternative way to pay? Learn how to pay by eCheck, in-person or by mail.

Things to Note

Wait listed participants can be contacted starting a week after first day of registration and up to the start of the second class. After the second class, all waitlists are voided. If the first class has already started, fees will not be prorated for past classes (you will be charged the full price) and there is no opportunity to cancel or transfer after the first scheduled class.

Classes, camps, fitness memberships, preschool, programs and more are at a price you can afford! Our fee reduction program helps Everyone, Everywhere, Every Day! Access for All. Whether you have a short-term set back or something longer term. Learn about our fee reduction program that helps people with lower incomes participate in Parks & Recreation programs.

We provide reasonable modifications for people with disabilities. Call the Therapeutic Recreation Office at 703-228-4740 or TTY 711 or email us.

Learn about our refund and religious accommodation policy and credit card fees.

'Resident' is defined as:

A person or family living within the geographical boundaries of Arlington County, Virginia.

A person or family whose property is bisected by the county boundary and that of an adjacent jurisdiction, such that real estate taxes are paid to Arlington County.

A person or family owning property and paying real estate taxes in Arlington County even though that person or family resides outside the county boundary (you may need to provide documentation).
